I stayed with them for a while, but they did not know me. I was very sad, and my eyes were filled with tears. I cried until I fell asleep, and when I woke up, I was back in my own home."}

src_text: Thän Chhappan Bhog ti 108 (kɛ thok ji̱ Hindu, kuan ti kɔ̱ŋ ti dëë cam ti cop 56, ce̱tkɛ, ala̱wɛni, dɛy jiɛɛn, thɔ̱a̱a̱r, cuɔm cuɔɔm amäni kɔ̱kiɛn ti ka̱mkɛ kuth) cua kɛ ka̱m Baba Shyam.
ref_text: 108 plates of Chhappan Bhog (in Hinduism, 56 different edible items, like, sweets, fruits, nuts, dishes etc. which are offered to deity) were served to Baba Shyam.
hyp_text: The 56th Bhog of Thän Chhappan is 108. I will go to Hindu, take 56, bring back 56, and return to Baba Shyam.

src_text: Tidɛ ɛn ɣöö cäŋ ci̱ tuar in te kä Ithtej in di̱i̱t thuɔ̱k,  dërɛ tuɔ̱ɔ̱k en ɣöö bɛ tekɛ buɔ̱n kä ji̱ pɛthti̱bɔl ti̱ bi̱ ŋot rɔm tuari̱ thi̱n amäni̱ wärdär
ref_text: Remember that even though music on the main stages may have finished, there may be sections of the festival that will keep playing music until late into the night.
